A schema version identifier the metadata object validates against. Note: this information is
only relevant in the domain of the API consumer: the issues system always considers metadata
just as an arbitrary object.

Resolution.description:
An optional field recording when and via what means an issue was resolved, if it was resolved.
Resolved issues are retained for XX days.

details.description: Optional details about the resolution. Used by Snyk Cloud so far.

resolved_at.description: The time when this issue was resolved.

iac_mappings_count.description: Amount of IaC resources this resource maps to.

id.description: Internal ID for a resource.

native_id.description: An optional native identifier for this resource. For example, a cloud resource id.

ResourcePathRepresentation.description: An object that contains an opaque identifying string.

Risk.description: Risk prioritization information for an issue

factors.description: Risk factors identified for an issue

RiskScore.description: Risk prioritization score based on an analysis model

model.description: Risk scoring model used to calculate the score value

value.description: Risk score value, which may be used for overall prioritization

Scopes.description: The scopes this app is allowed to request during authorization.

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1hr if unset. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

api_key.description: The Snyk API Key for this service account. Only returned on creation, and only when auth_type is api_key.

auth_type.description:
The authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

client_id.description: The service account's attached client-id. Used to request an access-token. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_client_secret or oauth_private_key_jwt.

client_secret.description: The client secret used for obtaining access tokens. Only sent on creation of new service accounts and cannot be retrieved thereafter. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_client_secret.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL used to verify signed JWT requests against. Must be https. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

level.description:
The level of access for the service account:
  * Group - the service account was created at the Group level.
  * Org - the service account was created at the Org level.

name.description: A human-friendly name of the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the Service Account is associated with.

default_org_context.description: ID of the default org for the service account.

name.description: The name of the service account.

level.description: Level of severity calculated via vector

score.description: The CVSS score calculated from the vector, representing the severity of the vulnerability on a scale from 0 to 10.

source.description: The source of this severity. The value must be the id of a referenced problem or class, in which case that problem or class is the source of this issue. If source is omitted, this severity is sourced internally in the Snyk application.

type.description: Indicates if the CVSS item is primary or secondary. Clients should prefer the primary CVSS vector.

vector.description: CVSS vector string detailing the metrics of a vulnerability.

version.description: CVSS version being described.

SeverityThreshold.description: Minimum Snyk issue severity to send a notification for, messages will not be sent for any issue below this value

name.description: Name of the Slack Channel

disclosure_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was disclosed.

publication_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was published.

title.description: Descriptor for an external reference to the issue

url.description: URL for an external reference to the issue

file.description:
A path to the file containing this issue, relative to the root of the project target,
formatted using POSIX separators.

data.description: IDs of items to add to a collection

Updated.description: The last time the settings were updated.

avatar_url.description: The avatar url of the user.

default_org_context.description: ID of the default org for the user.

name.description: The name of the user.

VersioningSchema.description:
The versioning scheme used by images in the repository.

A versioning schema is a system for identifying and organizing different versions of a project. 
It is used to track changes and updates to the project over time, and to help users identify which version they are using. 
A versioning schema typically consists of a series of numbers or labels that are incremented to reflect the progression of versions. 
For example, a versioning schema might use a series of numbers, such as "1.0", "1.1", "2.0", and so on, to indicate major and minor releases of a product. 
A consistent and well-defined versioning schema helps users and tools understand and track the development of a project.

VersioningSchemaCustomType.description:
The Custom Schema type is a way for Snyk to understand your companyโs container image tag versioning scheme,
enabling Snyk to give more accurate base image upgrade recommendations.

This schema type is essentially a regular expression that groups the different parts of an imageโs tag into comparable sections.

If your container image's tags follow a versioning scheme other than Semantic Versioning (SemVer), 
it is highly recommended that you select the "Custom Versioning" schema for your image repositories.

expression.description:
The regular expression used to describe the format of tags.
Keep in mind that backslashes in the expression need to be escaped due to being encompassed in a JSON string.

label.description:
A customizable string that can be set for a custom versioning schema to describe its meaning.
This label has no function.

VersioningSchemaSingleSelectionType.description:
The Single Selection Versioning Schema allows manual setting of which image should be given as a recommendation.

Only one image can be set as the current recommendation. If no images are set as the current selection, 
no recommendation will be given.

It is recommended to use this versioning schema if your repository's tags aren't supported by the other schemas.

is_selected.description:
Whether this image should be the recommendation. Only one image can be selected at a given time. Setting this
as true will remove previous selection.

name.description: User-defined name of the collection

APIToken.description: API key value must be prefixed with \"Token \".
APIToken.name: Authorization

get.description:
Get a list of custom base images with support for ordering and filtering.
Either the org_id or group_id parameters must be set to authorize successfully.
If sorting by version, the repository filter is required.

parameters.description: The organization ID of the custom base image
parameters.name: org_id

200.description: Returns custom base images

get.summary: Get a custom base image collection

post.description:
In order to create a custom base image, you first need to import your base images into Snyk.
You can do this through the CLI, UI, or API.

This endpoint marks an image as a custom base image. This means that the image will get
added to the pool of images from which Snyk can recommend base image upgrades.

Note, after the first image in a repository gets added, a versioning schema cannot be passed in this endpoint.
To update the versioning schema, the PATCH endpoint must be used.

requestBody.description: The properties used in the creation of a custom base image

201.description: Successfully created a custom base image

post.summary: Create a Custom Base Image from an existing container project

delete.description: Delete a custom base image resource. (the related container project is unaffected)

204.description: Successfully deleted the custom base image

get.description: Get a custom base image

200.description: Returns a custom base image

get.summary: Get a custom base image

patch.description: Updates a custom base image's attributes

requestBody.description: custom base image to be updated

200.description: Returns the updated custom base image

get.description:
Search audit logs for a Group. "api.access" events are omitted from results unless explicitly requested using the events parameter. Some Organization level events are supported as well as the following
Group level events:
  - api.access
  - group.cloud_config.settings.edit
  - group.create
  - group.delete
  - group.edit
  - group.notification_settings.edit
  - group.org.add
  - group.org.remove
  - group.policy.create
  - group.policy.delete
  - group.policy.edit
  - group.request_access_settings.edit
  - group.role.create
  - group.role.delete
  - group.role.edit
  - group.service_account.create
  - group.service_account.delete
  - group.service_account.edit
  - group.settings.edit
  - group.settings.feature_flag.edit
  - group.sso.add
  - group.sso.auth0_connection.create
  - group.sso.auth0_connection.edit
  - group.sso.create
  - group.sso.delete
  - group.sso.edit
  - group.sso.membership.sync
  - group.sso.remove
  - group.tag.create
  - group.tag.delete
  - group.user.add
  - group.user.remove
  - group.user.role.edit

Get a paginated list of all the organizations belonging to the group.
By default, this endpoint returns the organizations in alphabetical order of their name.

200.description: A list of organizations in the group.

get.summary: List all organizations in group

get.description: Get all service accounts for a group.

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Group that owns the service accounts.
parameters.name: group_id

200.description: A list of service accounts is returned.

get.summary: Get a list of group service accounts.

post.description: Create a service account for a group. The service account can be used to access the Snyk API.

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Group that is creating and owns the service account
parameters.name: group_id

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is one of the oauth_* variants.

auth_type.description:
Authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the created service account should use.

201.description: A new service account has been created

post.summary: Create a service account for a group.

delete.description: Permanently delete a group-level service account by its ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Group that owns the service account.
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: The ID of the service account.
parameters.name: serviceaccount_id

parameters.name: serviceaccount_id

post.description: Manage the client secret of a group service account by the service account ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Group that owns the service account.
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: The ID of the service account.
parameters.name: serviceaccount_id

mode.description:
Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated secret.
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets. A maximum of to two secrets can exist at a time.
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value. At least one secret must remain per service account.

secret.description: Secret to delete when using `delete` mode

200.description: Service account client secret has been updated.

post.summary: Manage a group service account's client secret.

delete.summary: Revoke app authorization for an Snyk Organization with install ID.

post.description: Manage client secret for non-interactive Snyk App installations.

parameters.description: Org ID
parameters.name: org_id

mode.description:
Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated
secret
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value

get.description:
This endpoint lets you retrieve the SBOM document of a software project.
It supports the following formats:
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in JSON (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+json`).
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in XML (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+xml`).
* SPDX version 2.3 in JSON (set `format` to `spdx2.3+json`).

By default it will respond with an empty JSON:API response.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for a project
parameters.name: project_id

200.description: Returns the SBOM document of a project

post.description: Create a service account for an organization. The service account can be used to access the Snyk API.

parameters.description: The ID of the Snyk Organization that is creating and will own the service account.
parameters.name: org_id

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is one of the oauth_* variants.

auth_type.description:
Authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the created service account should use. Obtained in the Snyk UI, via "Group Page" -> "Settings" -> "Member Roles" -> "Create new Role". Can be shared among multiple accounts.

201.description: A new service account has been created

mode.description:
Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated secret.
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets. A maximum of to two secrets can exist at a time.
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value. At least one secret must remain per service account.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: The request was missing these required fields: ...

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

version.description: Version of the JSON API specification this server supports.

500.description: Internal Server Error: An error was encountered while attempting to process the request.

deprecation.description:
A header containing the deprecation date of the underlying endpoint. For more information, please refer to the deprecation header RFC:
https://tools.ietf.org/id/draft-dalal-deprecation-header-01.html

snyk-request-id.description: A header containing a unique id used for tracking this request. If you are reporting an issue to Snyk it's very helpful to provide this ID.

snyk-version-lifecycle-stage.description: A header containing the version stage of the endpoint. This stage describes the guarantees snyk provides surrounding stability of the endpoint.

snyk-version-requested.description: A header containing the version of the endpoint requested by the caller.

snyk-version-served.description: A header containing the version of the endpoint that was served by the API.

tags.description:
Through the Custom Base Image Recommendation feature, Snyk can recommend an image upgrade from a pool of the your internal images. 
This allows your teams to be notified of newer and more secure versions of internal base images.

Notable changes to this API resource:
- starting with version "2023-09-20", the `GET` `/custom_base_images` endpoint requires the `repository` filter when sorting by `version`.
- starting with version "2024-01-04", `VersioningSchema` objects with `type` `"date"` are no longer supported. Snyk recommends updating custom base images with the deprecated type to `"single-selection"`.
tags.name: Custom Base Images
